intro: Rhysolepis hatschbachii, commonly known as the Hatschbach's rhyolepis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
